info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 30 at 9:47PM EDT until May 31 at 4:00AM EDT by NWS Baltimore MD/Washington DC
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of central Maryland, including the following county, Anne Arundel.
* WHEN...Until 400 AM EDT Saturday.
* IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 946 PM EDT, emergency management reported a couple of roads closed due to flooding. Flooding is already occurring. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.7 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Annapolis... Mayo... Naval Academy... South River... Severn River... Rhode River... Parole... Londontowne... Edgewater... Riva... Highland Beach... Hillsmere Shores... Eastport... Navy-Marine Corps Stadium... Bay Ridge... Edgewater Beach... - Please visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM EDT SATURDAY
